content:
A blog post by Google is making rounds - they're highlighting a bunch of issues in open-source security, such as vulnerability tracking, supply chain attacks, and other stuff. Also calling for better standardization and interoperability between vulnerability databases:
https://opensource.googleblog.com/2021/02/know-prevent-fix-framework-for-shifting-discussion-around-vulnerabilities-in-open-source.html

We can ride the marketing wave if we so desire, since we've been working on most of the items listed:
RustSec + https://github.com/RustSec/cargo-audit + https://github.com/Shnatsel/rust-audit address vulnerability tracking
https://github.com/rust-secure-code/cargo-supply-chain + https://github.com/crev-dev/cargo-crev address supply chain issues

This means we can make a blog post saying "hey we've known this all along and have actually been working on all of this"
If we include some outstanding work items, this might even get us some contributors.
as it were, I feel like I've done this sort of analysis manually before, heh https://github.com/iqlusioninc/abscissa/#depencencies
especially if it can spit out that sort of information automatically for incorporation into a README.md
